Dispute_Type: Refugee protection claim based on membership in a particular social group
Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in failing to consider the applicant's membership in a particular social group (women from Haiti who have been raped)
Evidence_Assessment: Applicant's testimony regarding rape and fear of re-victimization
Burden_of_Proof: On the applicant to establish a well-founded fear of persecution
Credibility_Factor: Applicant's account of being raped and fear of returning to Haiti
Legal_Rule: The Board must consider all grounds for claiming refugee status, even if not explicitly raised by the claimant
Procedural_Issue: Failure to address central aspect of the claim
Grounds_for_Claim: Gender-based persecution; membership in a particular social group
Outcome_on_Merits: Not assessed due to procedural error
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Board's failure to consider key claim element rendered decision unreasonable
Key_Evidence_Considered: Allegation of rape, risk of re-victimization, country conditions in Haiti
Applicant_Challenge: Board failed to consider gender-based persecution claim
Court_Result: Remanded for redetermination by a different panel
Legal_Rule_Source: Jurisprudence on refugee protection and particular social group
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Fear of gender-based violence upon return to Haiti
Governing_Rule: Duty of decision-makers to meaningfully engage with all claimed grounds for protection
